page.title:
HEASARC
HEASARC
page.normal_text:
Provides access to all the publically available X- and gamma-ray datasets. Also many general catalogs and datasets held at other data centers (eg Chandra and XMM-Newton).
Provides access to all the publically available X- and gamma-ray
datasets. Also many general catalogs and datasets held at other data
centers (eg Chandra and XMM-Newton).

Powerful search engine (Browse) with a uniform interface across missions.
Powerful search engine (Browse) with a uniform interface across
missions.

Batch processing and cross-correlation capabilities.
Batch processing and cross-correlation capabilities.

Includes bibliographic links to datasets where available.
Includes bibliographic links to datasets where available.

If you haven’t used browse before read the introduction at heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/W3Browse/w3browse-help.html
If you haven’t used browse before read the introduction at
heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/W3Browse/w3browse-help.html
page.footer:
X-ray Astronomy School 2007
X-ray Astronomy School 2007

page.title:
Chandra Data Archive
Chandra Data Archive
page.normal_text:
Provides access to all the Chandra datasets using an interface tailored for Chandra (http://asc.harvard.edu/cda).
Provides access to all the Chandra datasets using an interface
tailored for Chandra (http://asc.harvard.edu/cda). t a i l o r e d
f o r
C h a n d r a
( h t t p : / / a s c . h a r v a r d . e d u / c d a ) .

ChaSeR (java) and WebChaSeR (web page) provide search and retrieval of datasets.
ChaSeR (java) and WebChaSeR (web page) provide search and
retrieval of datasets.

Chandra Fast Image is a simplified interface intended for the general public but can also be used to get quick looks at data before deciding whether to download it.
Chandra Fast Image is a simplified interface intended for the
general public but can also be used to get quick looks at data
before deciding whether to download it.

Bibliography search for Chandra papers on a given object or observation.
Bibliography search for Chandra papers on a given object or
observation.

X-ray Astronomy School 2007

page.title:
XMM Science Archive
XMM Science Archive
page.normal_text:
Java-based interface provides access to all XMM-Newton datasets.
Java-based interface provides access to all XMM-Newton
datasets.

Many XMM-specific search options including on attributes in the EPIC source catalog.
Many XMM-specific search options including on attributes in
the EPIC source catalog.

Optical images from the source ID program.
Optical images from the source ID program.

New users should take the guided tour at http://xmm.esac.esa.int/external/xmm_data_acc/xsa/docs/tour.shtml
New users should take the guided tour at
http://xmm.esac.esa.int/external/xmm_data_acc/xsa/docs/tour.shtml

page.title:
Mirror sites
Mirror sites
page.normal_text:
Several sites mirror some datasets. You should use these if you are physically located near them.
Several sites mirror some datasets. You should use these if you
are physically located near them.

LEDAS at Leicester University in the UK has mirrors of the Chandra, ASCA, ROSAT archives and the XMM source catalog (http://ledas-www.star.le.ac.uk).
LEDAS at Leicester University in the UK has mirrors of the
Chandra, ASCA, ROSAT archives and the XMM source catalog
(http://ledas-www.star.le.ac.uk).

DARTS at ISAS in Japan has several archival datasets including a mirror of the ROSAT All-sky survey (http://darts.isas.jaxa.jp).
DARTS at ISAS in Japan has several archival datasets including
a mirror of the ROSAT All-sky survey (http://darts.isas.jaxa.jp).

ASDC in Italy has BeppoSAX, ASCA, and ROSAT datasets (http://www.asdc.asi.it).
ASDC in Italy has BeppoSAX, ASCA, and ROSAT datasets
(http://www.asdc.asi.it).
page.footer:
X-ray Astronomy School 2007
X-ray Astronomy School 2007

page.title:
CALDB
CALDB
page.normal_text:
One of the problems in X-ray astronomy is the large number of files that are usually required to store all the calibration information for an instrument. Keeping track of these and making these available to the data analysis software is challenging.
One of the problems in X-ray astronomy is the large number of
files that are usually required to store all the calibration
information for an instrument. Keeping track of these and
making these available to the data analysis software is
challenging.

The CALDB is a directory structure and indexing system for FITS files which enables software to read the correct calibration data without needing to know the filename or directory.
The CALDB is a directory structure and indexing system for
FITS files which enables software to read the correct calibration
data without needing to know the filename or directory.

Users can either install a CALDB locally or for occasional use access the calibration files from the HEASARC site.
Users can either install a CALDB locally or for occasional use
access the calibration files from the HEASARC site.

CALDB is used for HEASARC archival and current missions and for Chandra but not (alas) for XMM.
CALDB is used for HEASARC archival and current missions
and for Chandra but not (alas) for XMM.
page.footer:
X-ray Astronomy School 2007
X-ray Astronomy School 2007

page.title:
Software packages
Software packages
page.normal_text:
HEAsoft - heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/docs/software/lheasoft
HEAsoft - heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/docs/software/lheasoft H E A s o f t - h e a s a r c . g s f c . n a s a . g o v / d o c s / s o f t w a r e / l h e a s o f t

CIAO - asc.harvard.edu/ciao
CIAO - asc.harvard.edu/ciao C I A O - a s c . h a r v a r d . e d u / c i a o

SAS - xmm.vilspa.esa.es/external/xmm_sw_cal/sas_frame.shtml
SAS - xmm.vilspa.esa.es/external/xmm_sw_cal/sas_frame.shtml S A S - x m m . v i l s p a . e s a . e s / e x t e r n a l / x m m _ s w _ c a l / s a s _ f r a m e . s h t m l

All these packages operate on FITS files with standard formats defined for each type of dataset. We have attempted to make it possible to mix and match tools from different packages.
All these packages operate on FITS files with standard formats
defined for each type of dataset. We have attempted to make it
possible to mix and match tools from different packages.

page.title:
HEAsoft
HEAsoft
page.normal_text:
Large and diverse package distributed by NASA Goddard.
Large and diverse package distributed by NASA Goddard.

Latest release is 6.3.1. Runs under Linux, Solaris, OS-X, and Cygwin.
Latest release is 6.3.1. Runs under Linux, Solaris, OS-X, and
Cygwin.

Can be downloaded as either source code or binaries. The latter is usually adequate unless you want to apply source patches.
Can be downloaded as either source code or binaries. The latter is
usually adequate unless you want to apply source patches.

Contains generic multi-mission tools as well as packages for current missions RXTE, Swift, Suzaku and a number of archival missions.
Contains generic multi-mission tools as well as packages for
current missions RXTE, Swift, Suzaku and a number of archival
missions.

For help : heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/cgi-bin/ftoolshelp
For help : heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/cgi-bin/ftoolshelp

page.enlisting:
• XANADU - High-level, multi-mission tasks for X-ray astronomical spectral, timing, and imaging data analysis • FTOOLS - General and mission-specific tools for FITS files • FITSIO - Core library responsible for reading/writing FITS files • fv - General FITS file browser/editor/plotter with a graphical user interface (distributed with FTOOLS) • XSTAR - Tool for calculating the physical conditions and emission spectra of photo-ionized gases • PROFIT - Visualizing and modelling high-resolution spectra. • XANADU - High-level, multi-mission tasks for X-ray astronomical spectral, timing, and imaging data analysis • FTOOLS - General and mission-specific tools for FITS files • FITSIO - Core library responsible for reading/writing FITS files • fv - General FITS file browser/editor/plotter with a graphical user interface (distributed with FTOOLS) • XSTAR - Tool for calculating the physical conditions and emission spectra of photo-ionized gases

page.title:
CIAO
CIAO
page.normal_text:
Written for Chandra by the CXC but contains many tools that can be used for other purposes.
Written for Chandra by the CXC but contains many tools that can
be used for other purposes.

Current version is 3.4.0 which is supported on Solaris 8, Redhat 6.2, Redhat 8, and Mac OS X (both PowerPC and Intel). The Redhat 8 distribution should run on most modern Linux versions.
Current version is 3.4.0 which is supported on Solaris 8, Redhat
6.2, Redhat 8, and Mac OS X (both PowerPC and Intel). The
Redhat 8 distribution should run on most modern Linux versions.

The CIAO source is available but it is recommended that you download the binaries and not try to compile it yourself.
The CIAO source is available but it is recommended that you
download the binaries and not try to compile it yourself.

CIAO v4.0 development is under way and a Beta 1 distribution is available.
CIAO v4.0 development is under way and a Beta 1 distribution is
available.

For help : asc.harvard.edu/helpdesk
For help : asc.harvard.edu/helpdesk

X-ray Astronomy School 2007
X-ray Astronomy School 2007

CIAO components
CIAO components

Chandra-specific tools
Chandra-specific tools

Multi-mission DM (DataModel) tools
Multi-mission DM (DataModel) tools

ds9 image display
ds9 image display

ChIPS plotting package
ChIPS plotting package

Sherpa multidimensional fitting engine
Sherpa multidimensional fitting engine

GUIDE tool for identifying atomic features in spectra (uses the APED atomic physics database)
GUIDE tool for identifying atomic features in spectra (uses the
APED atomic physics database)

page.title:
SAS
SAS
page.normal_text:
Tools to be used on data from XMM-Newton.
Tools to be used on data from XMM-Newton.

Current version is 7.1.0 and is supported for Redhat 9.0, RHEL 3,4, Fedora Core 3, SuSE 7.3, 8.2, Solaris 8, 9, Mac OS X 10.3, 10.4 (PowerPC only), Windows via a virtual machine running Fedora Core 4.
Current version is 7.1.0 and is supported for Redhat 9.0, RHEL 3,4,
Fedora Core 3, SuSE 7.3, 8.2, Solaris 8, 9, Mac OS X 10.3, 10.4
(PowerPC only), Windows via a virtual machine running Fedora Core
4.

Binary versions only are available.
Binary versions only are available.

Requires the user to have installed : ds9, XPA, Grace, HEAsoft
Requires the user to have installed : ds9, XPA, Grace, HEAsoft

For help : xmm.vilspa.esa.es/external/xmm_user_support/xmmhelp_frame.shtml

xmm.vilspa.esa.es/external/xmm_user_support/xmmhelp_frame.shtml

page.title:
Hera
Hera
page.normal_text:
Run your analysis remotely on machines at GSFC. (http://heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/hera/startinghera.html)
Run your analysis remotely on machines at GSFC.
(http://heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/hera/startinghera.html)

Uses fv as a front-end. fv is a small stand-alone program that runs on Windows, Linux, Mac OS X. (http://heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/docs/software/ftools/fv)
Uses fv as a front-end. fv is a small stand-alone program that runs on
Windows, Linux, Mac OS X.
(http://heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/docs/software/ftools/fv) ( h t t p : / / h e a s a r c . g s f c . n a s a . g o v / d o c s / s o f t w a r e / f t o o l s / f v )

Through Hera you can run programs from HEAsoft, CIAO, and SAS without having to install any of them on your computer.
Through Hera you can run programs from HEAsoft, CIAO, and SAS
without having to install any of them on your computer.

Hera has high-speed access to the HEASARC archive.
Hera has high-speed access to the HEASARC archive.

On Linux and Mac OS X systems there is a command line interface :
On Linux and Mac OS X systems there is a command line interface :

fv -r <HEAsoft, CIAO or SAS command>
fv -r <HEAsoft, CIAO or SAS command>

page.title:
Filling event columns
Filling event columns
page.normal_text:
The first step is to calculate various event attributes such as the sky position, the energy, and, for CCDs, the grade. Usually this will be performed automatically for you in pipeline processing. However, if calibration files change you might want to reprocess.
The first step is to calculate various event attributes such as the sky
position, the energy, and, for CCDs, the grade. Usually this will be
performed automatically for you in pipeline processing. However, if
calibration files change you might want to reprocess.

For Chandra this is performed using the CIAO routines acis_process_events or hrc_process_events. Reprocessing involves setting the input parameters correctly and making sure that you have the latest calibration files.
For Chandra this is performed using the CIAO routines
acis_process_events or hrc_process_events. Reprocessing involves
setting the input parameters correctly and making sure that you have
the latest calibration files.

XMM reprocessing is performed using emproc, epproc, rgsproc for the MOS, PN, and RGS respectively.
XMM reprocessing is performed using emproc, epproc, rgsproc for
the MOS, PN, and RGS respectively.
page.footer:
X-ray Astronomy School 2007
X-ray Astronomy School 2007

page.title:
Cleaning and filtering
Cleaning and filtering
page.normal_text:
The next step is to remove events that do not meet some criterion for validity, remove events during any times of particularly bad background. You might also want to select only events within a particular region on the sky or on the detector.
The next step is to remove events that do not meet some criterion
for validity, remove events during any times of particularly bad
background. You might also want to select only events within a
particular region on the sky or on the detector.

There are many tools to select rows out of FITS files however you do need to be a bit careful about which ones are used. Other software may need to know what selections were made. For instance : suppose you select events within some time interval. You can’t reconstruct this selection just from the events left in the file because there might be real gaps in the data.
There are many tools to select rows out of FITS files however you
do need to be a bit careful about which ones are used. Other
software may need to know what selections were made. For
instance : suppose you select events within some time interval.
You can’t reconstruct this selection just from the events left in the
file because there might be real gaps in the data.
page.footer:
X-ray Astronomy School 2007
X-ray Astronomy School 2007

page.title:
Cleaning and filtering II
Cleaning and filtering II
page.normal_text:
Selections are tracked by storing additional information in the file either in keywords or extra extensions.
Selections are tracked by storing additional information in the file either
in keywords or extra extensions.

In CIAO this is done using the DataModel filtering. See ahelp dmfiltering for details.
In CIAO this is done using the DataModel filtering. See ahelp
dmfiltering for details.

The SAS has either a command line option called evselect or a GUI called xmmselect (xmm.vilspa.esa.es/sas/current/doc/evselect).
The SAS has either a command line option called evselect or a GUI
called xmmselect (xmm.vilspa.esa.es/sas/current/doc/evselect).

HEAsoft has a program xselect which can be used to perform filtering (through the filter command). xselect actually runs an ftool called extractor, which is available for the sophisticated user (http://heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/docs/software/lheasoft/ftools/xselect/xselect .html).
HEAsoft has a program xselect which can be used to perform filtering
(through the filter command). xselect actually runs an ftool called
extractor, which is available for the sophisticated user
(http://heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/docs/software/lheasoft/ftools/xselect/xselect
.html).

All these methods should be equivalent.
All these methods should be equivalent. A l l
t h e s e
m e t h o d s
s h o u l d b e
e q u i v a l e n t .
page.footer:
X-ray Astronomy School 2007
X-ray Astronomy School 2007

page.title:
Extracting products
Extracting products
page.normal_text:
Images, energy spectra, and lightcurves are histograms on event attributes so again one could use general software to create these but in many cases subsequent software requires particular keywords or extensions so it is better to use our standard tools.
Images, energy spectra, and lightcurves are histograms on event
attributes so again one could use general software to create these
but in many cases subsequent software requires particular
keywords or extensions so it is better to use our standard tools.

The HEAsoft program xselect has a command extract which can be used to make these products.
The HEAsoft program xselect has a command extract which can
be used to make these products.

evselect and xmmselect in SAS have options to create these products.
evselect and xmmselect in SAS have options to create these
products.

In CIAO dmextract is used to make energy spectra and lightcurves and dmcopy to make images.
In CIAO dmextract is used to make energy spectra and lightcurves
and dmcopy to make images.
page.footer:
X-ray Astronomy School 2007
X-ray Astronomy School 2007

page.title:
Creating observation calibration files
Creating observation
calibration files
page.normal_text:
Once you have your products you may need to create other files in order to continue with scientific analysis. For instance, analysis of images may need exposure maps and spectra require responses.
Once you have your products you may need to create other files in
order to continue with scientific analysis. For instance, analysis of
images may need exposure maps and spectra require responses.

These tools are always mission-specific since they depend on details of the instruments in use. For Chandra you will want to look at the appropriate analysis threads in : http://asc.harvard.edu/ciao/threads/index.html
These tools are always mission-specific since they depend on
details of the instruments in use. For Chandra you will want to
look at the appropriate analysis threads in :
http://asc.harvard.edu/ciao/threads/index.html

For SAS a good place to start is the XMM ABC guide at : http://xmm.gsfc.nasa.gov/docs/xmm/abc/abc.html
For SAS a good place to start is the XMM ABC guide at :
http://xmm.gsfc.nasa.gov/docs/xmm/abc/abc.html
page.footer:
X-ray Astronomy School 2007
X-ray Astronomy School 2007

page.title:
Analysis of products
Analysis of products
page.normal_text:
Finally, you can get to the scientific analysis you wanted to do in the first place. Source detection in images, fitting models to energy spectra, searching for periods in lightcurves,…
Finally, you can get to the scientific analysis you wanted to do in
the first place. Source detection in images, fitting models to energy
spectra, searching for periods in lightcurves,…

X-ray Astronomy School 2007
